statements: UPDATE user_preferences SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe', email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE user_id = 1
UPDATE user_preferences SET age = 30, preference_1 = 'Music', preference_2 = 'Sports' WHERE user_id = 2
UPDATE user_preferences SET age = 30, preference_1 = 'option A' WHERE user_id = 101
UPDATE user_preferences SET preference_2 = 'option B', first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe' WHERE user_id = 102
UPDATE users SET email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE user_preferences SET timezone = 'GMT' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE users SET email='newemail@example.com' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE user_preferences SET theme='dark', language='German' WHERE user_id=3;
UPDATE users SET age = 25, country = 'USA' WHERE user_id = 1234;
UPDATE content SET likes = likes + 1, dislikes = dislikes - 1 WHERE content_id = 5678;
UPDATE users SET age = 30, country = 'USA' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE preferences SET theme = 'Dark', language = 'Spanish' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE users SET age = 30, gender = 'Male' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE preferences SET font_size = 16 WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE users SET age = 30, gender = 'Male' WHERE user_id = 1001;
UPDATE preferences SET theme = 'Dark', font_size = 16 WHERE user_id = (SELECT user_id FROM users WHERE user_name = 'John Doe');
UPDATE users SET email='newemail@example.com', username='newusername' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE user_preferences SET font_size=16, theme='dark' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE users SET email = 'newemail@example.com', preferences = '{"theme": "dark", "font_size": 16}' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE user_interests SET interest_name = 'Music' WHERE user_id = 2;
